metadata.title: CVE-2024-38559 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:qedf: Ensure the copied buf is NUL terminated Currently, we allocate acount-sized kernel buffer and copy count from userspace to that buffer.Later, we use kstrtouint on this buffer but we don't ensure that the stringis terminated inside the buffer, this can lead to OOB read when usingkstrtouint. Fix this issue by using memdup_user_nul instead of memdup_user.
